Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libcgroup
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: libcgroup bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The libcgroup packages provide tools and libraries to control and monitor control groups. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the parameters for the test_cgroup2/ SPISE group were not set. As a consequence, running the "cgset --copy-from test_cgroup1/ test_cgroup2/" command failed with an error message. This update sets the parameters for test_cgroup2/, and the aforementioned command no longer fails. (BZ#963515) Prior to this update, the cgconfigparser utility wrote the whole multi-line value in the single write() function call, whereas the "devices" kernel subsystem expects only one line per write(). Consequently, cgconfigparser did not properly parse multi-line variables. The underlying source code has been fixed, and cgconfigparser now parses all variables as intended. (BZ#1142807) In the /etc/cgconfig.conf file, the cgroup named as "default" was not considered a valid name. As a consequence, /etc/cgconfig.conf file lost backward compatibility and failed to parse. With this update, double quotes are used when listing cgroup names, and /etc/cgconfig.conf is now parsed correctly. (BZ#1143851) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: With this update, cgcreate supports the "*" (asterisk) option. Now, if no controller is specified, it is assumed that all mounted controllers are taken into consideration. In addition, it is no longer mandatory to specify controller(s) in command-line options. If the user has not specified any controller, only a cgroup, then it is assumed that the operation applies to all mounted hierarchies. (BZ#885166) With this update, the /etc/cgconfig.d/ directory has been included in the libcgroup packages by default. It can contain additional cgroup config files specific to individual applications. This allows the user to ship his configuration files together with his application. (BZ#885174) This update provides a more detailed entry for the cgset utility in a number of libcgroup man pages, including examples demonstrating the correct syntax for setting the parameters of given cgroup(s). (BZ#886920) Users of libcgroup are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
